page.title: 14THE BAILLIESTON INTERCHANGE
page.content: The{Baillieston Interchange}is the{meeting point}of{four main roads. One of them is the{M74}heading to the{South.}This main artery carries a lot of people on holiday to{Blackpool or the{South of England. A lot of people go{West}using the{M8 into{Glasgow}to buy clothes and also it takes you to the{Clyde Coast. Going{East}on the{M8}we head for {Coatbridge}and{Edinburgh. The{North Road}the{M73}takes us to {Stirling}and from there on the{A9}we can go to the{most scenic parts}of {Scotland}in the{North. The{Interchange}is a good place to live as people use the{motorways}to {take them to work}and many large {lorries}use them instead of the {smaller roads.}My dad has to use the motorway to get to work about four times a day.
